title: An unkown error has occured while logging in
body:
So I've been dealing with this for a few weeks now with my newly setup desktop.  I've been working with Riot Support for a few weeks as well, and I have literally tried everything you could imagine.  I've looked through all the forums with the same or similar problems.

I've changed my DNS to a public Google DNS.  

Turned off my ppv6 (as I was instructed to do)

Have ran WinMTR on both my desktop and laptop (because it works on my laptop on the same internet connection)

Messed around with permission settings in the properties tab on the game client

Ran Hextech a millions times, and half a million times it crashed.

Disabled Cortana from windows

Ran troubleshooting on the league client 

That's all I can think of that I've done off the top of my head.  Any help and/or fresh ideas will be much appreciated.  Oh and sometimes it will randomly allow me to log in and I'm not sure what it triggering this.  Thanks in advance!

replies.body: Having this issue but only with my main account.I get the unexpected error message once then a permanent authenticating.Dont even get the message or a 3 second login time when i use my other account's info.

So, after looking over the ticket you had with our techs, it looks like they were able to narrow the main issue down to packet loss. They suggested you shoot those traceroutes over to your ISP to make sure they're aware that there's currently a problem with their routing which is causing such a large amount of packet loss. 

Packet loss happens before your connection ever reaches our servers, and it's not caused by any settings on your own network or pc, it just happens with bad routing or improperly working nodes that your ISP uses.
